photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was really good! However, based on other reviews, I got nervous about the chicken possibly burning and the dish being too salty and having an overwhelming cream cheese flavor--so I made some modifications. I added 1/4 c. chicken broth in with the butter, dressing mix, and chicken to ensure there would be no burning and that the chicken would be moist. I only used half of the dressing mix package, and I also seasoned the chicken a tad before putting it in the slow cooker.  For the sauce, I used a can of cream of chicken and mushroom (healthy choice), 1/2 of the cream cheese called for in the recipe (so, 4 oz.), and 1/4 c. milk. As far as cooking time goes, I only had to cook it on low for a little less than 4 hours before the chicken was cooked through. This will likely vary depending on the size of the fillets and the slow cooker itself (so keep your eye on it the 1st time). It took less than half an hour for the sauce to heat through with the chicken. Very good!!

text:
Amazingly easy! I use my crockpot religiously on Sundays during football season, and this one was one of the best! A few modifications: I used chicken tenderloins instead of breasts (less work for me!), 1 can cream of chix AND 1 can of cream of mushroom and I still added some milk to make it less thick. Also threw in some whole black peppercorns at the end for some extra flavor. Overall, loved it! Will definitely be making this again for me and my husband on gameday!

Would have rated it 5 stars except for the fact that it was so salty. Very tasty. I don't change a recipe the first time I make it but the breasts were so thick that I only used 3. text:
Fantastic, but I made a number of changes up front to fit our preferences.  Also, used a crock pot after research.  Sliced the chicken rather than cubed.  Two cans soup vs. one; this was partly to ensure that the crock pot was filled high enough not to burn since it was a large crock pot.  Half the dry Italian dressing.  A full stick of real butter rather than margarine.  Everyone loved it.  Yes, rich and not as healthy as we might prefer, but delicious!

text:
I always try to follow the recipe to the letter the first time before I rate it.  This time I had to make a couple of changes due to what I had available.  I used Cream of Mushroom soup instead of Cream of Chicken.  Because I was at work and was concerned about cooking the chicken with just the butter and seasoning for 8+ hours while I was out,  I did add the soup before cooking.  I used half a packet of seasoning (I noticed other reviewers did the same - we are watching our sodium intake)  Served over noodles and It turned out fantastic!  The family loved it and went back for more.  So simple but so flavorful.  Would definitely make again and I want to try it without the soup at the start when I'm able to keep a closer eye on it.

text:
This was seriously simple and seriously yummy!  We spend several hours in church on Sunday so I like a meal that makes itself so it's ready when we come home and everyone is starving.  I used what I had on hand so substituted sour cream for the cream cheese.  I served it over jasmine rice I put in the rice cooker on a delayed start so everything could be ready when we got home from church vs. noodles that would have had to be cooked.  If you're trying to do more primal/paleo eating, you could serve over a potato instead of rice or noodles.  My teens are a little picky and they loved it as did Mom and Dad.  Will definitely keep on my rotating list of favorites.

text:
This was great. The entire family loved it. I put 3 frozen chicken breasts , the soup, and a package of ranch dressing ( didn't have Italian, it was just as good)in the crock pot on low for 6 hours. I then added 8 oz of whipped cream cheese and 1 cup of sour cream. Cooked on high for another 30 minutes. Poured over egg noodles. It was so creamy the chicken just fell apart.

text:
Looks & sounds delicious & easy.  I'll brown the chicken (on the stovetop) in an uncovered Dutch oven, since browning will give it more flavor.  At that point, I might as well just continue on with the recipe and cook it (all) on the stove in the Dutch oven.  I think I'll add in some sliced mushrooms, and top off everyone's dish with roughly chopped fresh parsley.  (I wish that the Nutritional Info per portion was posted along with the recipes on this  site., since some folks have health issues which they need to consider.)

As another put it, this is a great easy "busy day" crockpot recipe which is what I was looking for, but  I don't know how anyone cooked the cubed chicken in the butter and Italian dressing mix for 7 to 8 hours (on low.) text:
This is very versatile. I used a half bottle of prepared dressing instead of dry mix. I used a family size can of soup, and I used a quarter cup of cream cheese. I also added a cube of vegetable bullion. It came out thick and rich. We also tried this with steak, and it was wonderful.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614259.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Super easy and simple recipe, tastes really good considering how simple the prep and procedure were...I followed a number of reviewer's mods. Used 1/2 a cup of white wine, 3 tbsp of butter, with only 1 chicken breast cubed. Didn't have Italian dressing dry packet, so I sub with a packet of dry Tuscan chicken seasoning (club house brand). Plus a cup of sliced onion. All in and on low for 5 hours. Then one full can condense cream of chicken soup with 2/3 cup of Greek yogurt (again, I didn't have any sour cream or cream cheese on hand). Still super yum with brown rice pasta. 
It's a great base recipe that can be modify to suit a variety of diet requirement. The only thing that is pretty much indispensable is the condense soup, don't think there can be a sub for that....next time, I think i will try with coconut oil instead of butter. My preference for Greek yogurt is because of the added protein, I am sure that cream cheese would make it taste a lot richer.   
Definitely a keeper for my slow cooker recipe.

text:
Recipe definitely needs some work.  The 8 oz.cream cheese makes it too thick.  I added chicken broth, worchestershire sauce, white wine, still blah.  If I fix it again, I'll use 4 oz. cream cheese and 4 oz. sour cream, and maybe add a little sherry.Also, good thing I added some chicken broth when adding the chicken and salad dressing.  Fixed it on my lunch hour, and when I came home 5 hrs. later it was almost dry.  So, if you'll be away from home, add some liquid.

text:
This was very easy to make and tasty and cheap. I made some minor alterations. I used butter instead of margarine and also added in a splash of chicken broth. The chicken by itself was starting to burn. I also stirred the chicken regularly. I cooked the chicken on low for about three hours. For the last half hour I put it on high and added in the soup. Then added the cream cheese at the end and let the cream cheese warm up in the Crockpot for a few minutes before I added the noodles. I would probably add some paprika next time for a little more flavor.

Display Name:
Susan Brotherton

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614248.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This a great base recipe that is super easy! I did make a few changes. I cooked the chicken with Italian dressing, as the recipe calls for. There was enough juice that cooked out of the chicken. It does not need any other liquid added at this stage. I also added half a chopped onion at this point. I started with about 1 1/3 lb. chicken. Once I chopped it up, was a lot of meat and was worried that one can of soup was not enough. I started with a can of cream of mushroom and 1/2 the cream cheese. I planned to add sour cream as others suggested. It tasted great but not enough sauce. I then added a can of cream of chicken as the recipe calls for. This totally changed the taste. Was much better before this. I also found it a tad bit bland and needed extra seasoning. I will make this again. Will add 2 cans of cream of mushroom and omit cream of chicken. Will also add a second pack of Italian dressing to compensate for the extra sauce, and add more flavor. I don't believe sticking with all the cream cheese or adding sour cream really makes much of a difference. Overall, we really enjoyed this!

text:
My chicken was done in about 3.5 hours. I added a little sour cream to mine. I used 2.7 oz of Italian dressing mix due to not paying attention to the instructions but it wasn't much of a problem. I also used 2 tablespoons of butter instead of 1 tablespoon of margarine. My biggest tips would be DO NOT SEASON YOUR CHICKEN with anything other than the Italian dressing mix. My family loved the recipe. The chicken was so tender! Went nicely over egg noodles. I think if i would have left the chicken unattended it could have resulted in dry, possibly burnt meat.

text:
I followed the recipe exactly, and the taste was ok.  It was like one of those quick instant pasta sauce kinda taste. Didn't taste like a regular or traditional stroganoff, perhaps, substituting cream cheese with sour cream could have made a bit more authentic taste.  Meat was soft and easy to chew, but not sure a good chicken meat is a fit for this recipe, as I rather wanted to enjoy just a normally cooked meat than overly soft chicken meat (lost flavor).  Overall, if you don't want to use a canned or instant sauce and still want a satisfaction of so-called "homemade" sauce, then, this menu could work.

Display Name:
Tb-SMSU

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I found this recipe on Pinterest and thought that would try because it seems very easy. It was certainly easy to make and tasted really good. I didn’t follow the exact times of the recipe. It suggests to let chicken cook with the Italian dressing for 4 ½ hours before adding the cream cheese and soup. I think that I added the cream cheese and soup after 2 hours of cooking. I don’t believe it will make much of a difference if you mix everything together sooner. I served it over noodles instead of rice so it would be more like a stroganoff. I put in only half of the packet of Italian dressing mix after reading reviews that said it was too salty. I thought the taste was perfect so I would recommend only using half of the Italian dressing mix. However, it was almost too creamy for me. I think next time that I might try using half of the cream cheese and maybe add some white wine. I think that it definitely made enough sauce as it seemed to be more sauce than chicken. Next time, I think I’ll try adding some onions and mushrooms to the sauce. I think this recipe can be absolutely delicious with some slight tweaking. All in all, it makes for a quick and tasty meal.

text:
5 Quick Tips: To darken, mix some paprika into soup before adding to the crockpot. Season the chkn w/ a Good Seasons packet before slicing them up. I find 3/4 bar of cream cheese is more than enough. If sauce is too thick, in last hour of cooking thin it with a splash of wine or chkn.broth. In the last 20-30 mins, add in 3 or 4 heaping handfuls of freshly cut ribbons of Swiss Chard to add fabulous color, texture, and flavor. WOW, THIS IS JUST TOO DELISH 2B THIS EZ!!??

Display Name:
Darla Grumbles
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674159.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Like many others who have left reviews, I ended up revamping the recipe to make it my own. I cubed the chicken, used the salad dressing mix, and the margarine. However I only cooked the mixture long enough for the chicken to whiten, approximately 1.5 hours on low. I then added one small can of cream of mushroom soup and cooked it all for one more hour. Since I was preparing this late at night, I ended up putting the chicken mixture in the refrigerator over night. The next day, I heated the mixture, added 1 small bag of frozen green beans, half of a small onion (chopped), 1 small can of sliced mushrooms, and only half of a block of cream cheese. This I cooked until everything was hot, but the onions were still crunchy. I served it over egg noodles. Overall, we loved how it turned out. I do think if I had made it exactly how the recipe called for, we would have been very dissapointed. Next time, I think I will add some sliced carrots and maybe either frozen cauliflower or corn.

text:
I found it to be just OK at best. It was way too salty and way too thick. I only used two large chicken breasts but left sauce amounts the same. I also only put in half the italian dressing packet. In the end I had to add 1/2 a can of chicken stock to thin it out and then it was still too thick. Likely if I make this again I will use a whole can of stock, a whole can of cream of mushroom soup rather than cream of chicken (both will be low sodium)and only 4 oz of cream cheese and only use one tablespoon of the seasoning packet. Plus I will add some mushrooms and diced onions to give it a little better flavor. It was just average to less then average as it was. I'm sure the leftovers will end up in the trash.

text:
I really like this recipe.  It was easy.  I used frozen chicken and I did add in some chicken broth to keep it moist.  I think it is a little too thick, so I just added in more chicken broth.  I was making this for another family, so I didn't add anything. But I can see how versatile this recipe could be, by adding in fresh mushrooms and peas and carrots or even broccoli, or even going fancy and doing spinach, artichokes and sundried tomatoes.  Easy and delicious as is though!  I used whole wheat noodles too and the low fat cheese and soup.  I doubled this and 1 packet of dressing was plenty.

text:
SO EASY!!!  This is my second time using this recipe.  I had a frozen package of boneless chicken  breasts so I looked up a slow cooker recipe. I cubed the 3 large breast and I used 2 cans of cream of chicken with one package of italian seasoning mix (I like lots of gravy).  I did not use any butter, but I don't think it needed it. I added the cream cheese 30 minutes before serving, just enough time for it to melt. I normally serve it over white rice (boil-in-the-bag). I do not think it was too salty. My family loves this recipe and it smells great while it cooks.

userID:
849226
Display Name:
Shannon
isPro:

followersCount:

followingCount:

madeRecipesCount:
303
favoritesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2787858.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I started with a 1/2 packet of the Good Seasonings garlic & herb mix and added as I went along, eventually using the entire packet. I used 1 can cream of chicken, 1 can cream of mushroom and after adding the cream cheese, I thinned it out with a combination of half & half and water. I also tossed in some dried chives and parsley for a little color and about half an onion, diced and sauteed in 1 Tbsp butter and a little of the Good Seasonings mix. About 15 minutes before serving, I added about 8 oz of sour cream to tone down the cream cheese flavor a tad and it worked perfectly. My crockpot is a beast, so even at low, I had this on the table exactly 2.5 hours after I threw in the raw, cubed chicken. Served over a bed of egg noodles, it was pretty good. I would make it again with the addition of fresh, sauteed mushrooms thrown in at the end, as well as half the cream cheese and adding sour cream to taste. Next time, I'd like to try serving over a bed of garlicky, red mashed potatoes.

None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is great as is! The only thing I did after making it as written the first time was to have it with some steamed broccoli on the side the second time.
It is a little bit heavy and creamy with the soup and cream cheese so I think having a good side of veggies helps to balance that out.
When I made this a third time I added a splash of red wine in the beginning (which is a good way to add moisture without altering the flavor for those who are worried about too little liquid from the start)
All in all, great recipe to come home to after a long day at work.

text:
Surprisingly fantastic. Only change, I added about 1/2 cup sour cream with the cream cheese. I did not reduce any of the existing elements. I used an all natural version of the Italian Dressing, worked great no issue. I cooked the egg noodles al dente then added them to the pot and folded them in gently. About 15 minutes later the noodles were perfectly yummy. So bland otherwise, must must get your noodles in that sauce before serving. Such a satisfying dinner. Definitely heavy, however. Husband loved it, unfortunately my 4 and 2 year olds would not touch the noodles and only ate the chicken plain with no sauce. Consequently, not a perfect meal for my situation, but it will be great leftovers for me and hubby.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
It was tasty, but really kind of a belly-buster.  If you are looking for something light, this is not the recipe to make.

At lunchtime, I threw in the frozen chicken breasts, 3/4 of the salad dressing mix and fat free cream of mushroom soup into the crockpot on low. I added a generous heaping of sliced fresh mushrooms but NO margarine or butter.  Came home 5 hours later and added 3/4 container of low fat cream cheese, shredded the chicken in the crockpot, and began boiling water for the egg noodles.

Very easy to make, but as I said, it was a HEAVY meal. I had to add some milk to the sauce - it was way thick.  I took the leftover sauce, added some more milk to thin it out a bit, and froze it for another meal.

This is a great recipe and one that I will definitely be holding onto.  I have two boys that are picky eaters and they absolutely loved it!  I did make a few changes just because I didn't have it on hand.  Instead of dry mix, I used 3 TBS of Italian dressing, 1/4 cup cooking wine, put that in with the butter and chicken and let cook on low.  Then mixed together soup, cream cheese and 1/2 cup sour cream.  Mixed it altogether first then poured over chicken and cooked while I was cooking the egg noodles.  Delicious, thanks for sharing.

text:
Easy and delicious!  Like others, I use reduced fat cream cheese, and add fresh mushrooms.  For an added flare when I have the time, I sear the chicken first on the grill just enough to get the extra flavor and golden brown touch.  I slice into medalions instead of cube, which impacts presentation more than flavor.  This is one that if I forget about it for awhile, the family requests it!  I serve it over Whole Grain noodles or regular egg noodles if I can't find the whole grain.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Loved it! Some changes: I didn't have a packet of dressing mix, so I googled it and used dry spices on hand to approximate the mix. I used sour cream instead of cream cheese, and also doubled the cream of chicken soup to make it nice and saucy. I started with frozen chicken breast halves. They were cooked and ready to shred within 4 hours on low. I wouldn't cube the chicken first, because I think that would make it dry. A perfect meal with egg noodles and some broccoli - my 4 year old raved and raved.

text:
I didn't get the rave reviews on this dish from the kids like others did.  When we first came home the house smelled so good, and I couldn't wait to eat it, but we had to leave again, and let it cook some more on just warm instead of low.  The chicken alone tasted great!  But the cream cheese and soup was very thick even though I added it at the very end like the recipe called for.  In the end it was like eating a past or a thicker version of Elmers glue.  I might try it one more time to see if I can thin it out some, but I have four kids and if they won't eat it, it is a waste for us.  Again, I could have done something wrong, or my kids just may be the odd ones.  So don't count it out, just try it.

text:
A few additions make this dish company-worthy: Put the chicken and seasonings in the slow-cooker with a cup of diced onion and some white wine for about an hour before adding the rest of the ingredients. Adding a package of sliced mushrooms boosts the flavor of the dish. If you like it, drizzle on a little white truffle oil just before serving! Toss on a sprinkle of fresh chopped parsley for some color.

This is delicious!  I made 2 small changes.  Added fresh sliced mushrooms in the last 1/2 hour of cooking and did add a little chicken broth as the "sauce" was quite thick.  I also recommend mixing together the cream cheese and soup until smooth before adding to the chicken, otherwise the cream cheese is a little chunky.  This was an easy and quite flavorful weeknight meal.  Will definately make again!

text:
I have enjoyed all of the creative reviews. With my first try at making this dish, I started the project a bit too late in the day to use my slow cooker.  I grabbed a sizable Corningware casserole & lid and baked the first three ingredients in a 300 degree oven for a good hour then I premixed the soup and cream cheese together & added it to the casserole and continued baking for about another half hour.  Wouldn't you know it, I had only a small amount of dried noodles on hand with no time to even make a batch of homemade ones so, I boiled 2/3 of a pkg. of Radiatori pasta in place of the noodles.  Any kind would suffice.  All I can say is YUM!  
I made a doubled batch yesterday, in the slow cooker, for company.  It was a hit.  Thank you Judi Ann and all of the Reviewers.

text:
Pretty darn good!  I wanted a true stroganoff flavor so I used Lawry's Beef Stroganoff seasoning packet instead of the italian dressing.  I also used about 1/2 cup of sour cream, since a true stroganoff uses that as well.  My family also loves their pasta's saucey, so I used one can of chk mushroom, and 1 can of cream of chk.  Lastly, I added some baby bella mushrooms.   Came out really well.  Like other reviewers I used Healthy Start soups, fat free sour cream and fat free cream cheese.  The flavor was still there.  I ended up using Farfalle as the pasta, since I couldn't find a healthier egg noodle.   Will make again.

I followed the recipe as some others had suggested and cooked the frozen chicken breasts in the dry italian dressing mix, cream of mushroom and cream of chicken soups, mixed with about 1/4-1/2 cup of milk for 5 hours.  At the end, I added in 1/4 block of cream cheese and 1/2 cup of sour cream for about 30 minutes.  Turned out absolutely delicious and even my picky husband went back to finish off the pot!

I did not have time to make this in the slow cooker, but i followed the recipe as closely as i could on the stove. My family did enjoy this and the leftovers were gone quickly.  It is something i will make again, but its not one of our all time favorites.

text:
EASY great recipe.  Just a few changes for me to reduce sodium and fat.  I read all the reviews and to balance the cream cheese and sour cream tastes, I added around 1/2 tsp dried dill - really kicked up the flavor.  I used dried Italian herbs instead of the Italian dressing and reduced the cream cheese to 1/2 cup and 1/2 cup sour cream. I also used Best Life Butter spread to mix the Italian herbs in and then spread that on the chicken breasts. I think this may be more healthful - I hope, because it'll be a often repeated dish.  THANKS SO MUCH FOR THE RECIPE.

None
text:
This was great and my picky kids loved it!  Put whole chicken breasts in the crockpot and topped with the italian seasonings and the cream chicken soup.  Cooked on low about 4 hours and then shredded the chicken and stirred in the sour cream and some frozen peas and cooked another hour or so.  Ended up adding in a little water at the end because the sauce was really thick.  Skipped the cream cheese as the flavor was great without it.  Served over egg noodles- will definitely be making this again.

text:
This was great - but since I started it at 2, I didn't have 7 hrs before dinner to let it cook slowly. So, I browned the chicken in the butter after coating it was salad dressing. It turned out great but had to be careful to  not let it burn. Then, I put it in the crock pot with cream cheese, and since I didn't have Cream of Chicken Soup, I used 1/2c sour cream and the liquid from of a can of Campbell's Chicken Noodle. I served it over wide egg noodles - everyone loved it - THANKS!

text:
My entire family devoured this even though the first time I forgot to mix in the cream cheese (D'oh). This also made the ranch extremely powerful. However, it was still tasty and I'm getting ready to make it again tomorrow (with the cream cheese!.) The only change I made was to use pre-packaged frozen chicken breasts and put them in the crockpot frozen and whole with the butter and ranch dressing. I then shredded the chicken and mixed in some cream of chicken soup and some chicken broth. I served it over egg noodles. Looking forward to trying this recipe properly prepared.

userID:
3705609
Display Name:
Jody Purdie
isPro:

recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2509403.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was sooo easy to make.  I simply took frozen boneless/skinless chicken breasts (3 of them) and thawed them a bit in the microwave (since I forgot to take them out ahead of time).  I then rinsed them and cut them into pretty good size chunks and added them to the crockpot.  I then added 1/2 can of chicken broth and 1 can of cream of chicken soup plus the Italian seasoning packet.  I mixed it all together and put it on high for about 3 hours, then I put it on low for another hour.  I added the cream cheese just before I was getting the noodles cooked to use to mix with it.  I cooked 1 lb. of noodles, mixed in the sauce w/chicken and walla!  It was a big hit with all and the chicken was sooo moist!  Will definitely make again.  Great for those who don't have much time to cook.
Review:
Rating:
4

This recipe was so hyped up, I'm not sure if it was my expectations or what, but it just wasn't ALL THAT.  It was good and we ate it, but the line for seconds was non-existant.  In fact, I didn't save for leftovers because nobody would eat them, either. The chicken was rubbery and I cooked to the low end of the time provided.  BUT, we did eat it and it was EASY.  Just not, well... ALL THAT.

country:

text:
Still getting use to using a crock pot, but this dish turned out amazing.  I, like a lot of reviewers, was a bit concerned about only putting the chicken, seasoning and butter in for hours beforehand. But the chicken was tender as can be and pretty much fell apart when I went to cut it up before adding the rest of the ingredients.   I used cream of mushroom soup, I sauteed mushrooms and onions in white wine to add to the mixture as well as water chestnuts, chicken broth, and a bit of Chardonnay.  I let the cream cheese melt a bit on top before mixing it in.    The dish is delicious and I will for sure make it again.  Next time, I will use more pepper in the dish or maybe something to add a bit of a kick too it.

text:
What a wonderful easy meal. This reminded me so much of my home made chicken paprikash but creamier. Because I made this while I was at work I didn't feel comfortable leaving the crockpot with dry ingredients only so I added the cream of chicken soup in with the chicken. I also added a splash of white cooking wine per other reviews. I set the timer for 7 hours on low. I added about half to 3/4 of an 8 ounce block of cream cheese when I got home and cooked for an additional 30 minutes on high. Served over whole wheat pasta and a side of green beans amandine.

text:
one of the best crockpot chicken dishes I have had. I made a few tweaks to lower the fat and sodium: only 4 oz cream cheese, no margarine, add low sodium chicken broth to desired consistency. also, if desired, use fine mesh strainer to remove salt from dry italian seasoning packet as there is plenty of salt in canned soup.

country:
None
text:
I was extremely hesitant about this recipe since the chicken goes in with only 1/8 cup of margarine and a packet of seasoning mix... but I read reviews and other people had the same concerns and stated it turned out great! Well... I don't know if it is my slow cooker that is different or if I did something wrong, but JUST AS I EXPECTED the chicken after 7 hours on low was charred! Blackened! I added the cream cheese and soup at this point, and it tasted good, but it was more like chicken jerky than tender chicken cutlets...No idea why everyone else had it turn out great and mine was charred, but it was a bummer. I gave this recipe 1 star for ease, and 1 star for flavor (it actually tastes alright despite the chicken jerky and burnt aftertaste). But otherwise, I remain hesitant to ever put anything in the slow cooker with little/no water.

text:
I wanted to make something hot, hearty & easy today. My BF was home sick with the flu & I thought it would be nice for him to enjoy the house smelling like I was home cooking for him all day when I really had to work. This fit the bill perfectly. I read a lot of reviews and made the following changes to suit our taste; added mushrooms, chopped onions , & 1/4 cup of chicken stock & used 3tbsp butter in step 1. Left on low for 5 hours. Added can of Cambells cream of chicken and mushroom soup & half a can of white wine, 1/2 of the low fat cream cheese along with some frozen peas. It turned out perfect. Served over brown rice.  Thank you Judi.

Made this tonight, and it was a total hit with the entire family.  Like other reviewers, I did change it up a bit.  I placed two pats of butter, a can of low sodium 98% fat free cream of chicken soup, and half a packet of dry beef strogranoff recipe in the slow cooker and mixed well.  I placed three large thawed chicken breasts on top, and rubbed a bit of the soup mixture on top.  After cooking for five hours on low, the chicken pulled apart very easily with two forks.  I added 4 oz of lowfat cream cheese (Neufactchel) and 4 oz of lowfat sourcream, stirred the mixture (letting quite a bit of heat escape in the process), and then let the contents simmer for about 45 minutes on low before pulling the plug on the cooker.  Still hot half an hour later, it was thick, rich, flavorful and tender...  Perfect.  Thanks to Judi for posting this winner!!!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2010-07-30T09:04:04.7

text:
This recipe reminds me of the Angel Hair Chicken on this site (which is one of my favourites). I did make a couple of modifications: used margarine instead of butter (and less than 1/8 cup), added 1/2 cup white wine, and I tought the sauce was too thick to serve with pasta so I added milk until the consistency was to my liking. Served over spaghetti pasta (the only pasta I had)... and it was DELICIOUS!

I would give this recipe 10 stars if I could!  I only made small changes out of necessity - I used 2 tbl of vegetable oil in place of margarine because I didn't have any on hand.  I used fat-free cream cheese and 98% fat-free cream of chicken soup and added a splash of 1% milk at the end because it was so thick.  Served it over wheat-blend egg noodles and it was so delicious!  THANKS!

text:
I made this tonight and it was delicious! The only changes I made were: I used butter instead of margarine, I used 2 FROZEN chicken breast halves and I used neufchatel cheese instead of cream cheese (because it has less fat than regular cream cheese). It was SO good and I will definitely make it again. The only thing I will do differently next time is add more liquid, either in the form of chicken broth at the beginning of cooking or another can of soup at the end, as the sauce was quite thick and a tad salty so it could have used some thinning out. I may also use low sodium canned soup next time to cut down on the saltiness.

text:
Made this exactly as instructed.  My husband and 3 year old, and 10 month old all loved it. Served it over egg noodles.  We didn't find it too salty as others have stated.  Next time, I think I will add some chopped onion and fresh mushrooms when I add the soup and cream cheese, just to give the meal some different textures and enhance flavors.  I think this might be good using strips of flank steak and maybe add some tomato paste.  Endless possibilities!  Thanks for sharing!  Also, I was short on time and cooked this in my crockpot on high for 1.5 hours then reduced heat to low when adding the soup and cream cheese for the last half hour.  Chicken fully cooked and tender and meal was ready from start to finish in just 2 hours!

Very good!  I followed reviewers advice and only used a half packet of Italian dressing, but I think the author was onto something and the whole packet would be better.  It was a little too mild with only a half packet.  I made it lighter by using 98% fat free cream of chicken soup and fat free cream cheese.  It was quite good, but could use a little more spice.  It also felt very heavy, but this would be excellent for the winter or a rainy day!  Yum!!

WOW!!!!!!!  This is so delicious and so easy!  Its the ultimate comfort food.  My family loved it and this will surely be on our dinner rotation.  I followed the recipe pretty much except I used 4 frozen boneless chicken breast & added a splash of red wine (which was all I had on hand).  I had read that others recommended this and I figured a little wine would only add to the recipe, so why not?!  I also shredded the chicken with two forks, right in the slow cooker bowl before adding the soup & cream cheese.  Served with buttermilk biscuits and a side of veggies.  Yum! Yum! Yum!

text:
Very easy recipe, as you can tell just by looking at it. It's a perfect comfort food for the winter, and I put it on a big bed of broad egg noodles. I did change a few things:  1) Reduced Fat cream cheese - still tasted great 2) Healthy Recipe soup - still tasted great 3) Added some spices...garlic, pepper, paprika 4) I had some massive chicken breasts, about 1 lb. each, so I only used three of them. Still, this thing lasted 5-6 meals!   I will certainly make this again when I don't have time to prepare anything big. It isn't the healthiest, but it's far from awful!

text:
Just got off the phone with my gf and had her turn the chicken breasts over while I'm at work and she said it tasted amazing. Altered the recipe a bit as advised by some other members. Used 4 chicken breasts, i can 98% fat free cream of mushroom soup, 1 can cream of chicken, 1/2 package of the italian mix, 3/4 cup milk, 1 tbsp butter and just a little (1/16 cup) water as i knew I'd be at work awhile and didn't want the chicken drying out (unlikely) or the sauce getting too thick. Can't wait to get home and try it myself but she is picky and said it was amazing. Thanks a lot

city:

country:
None
text:
The highest compliment I receive is when my family requests a recipe. This one fit the bill. Even without changes, it was fantastic. I did make some changes, though. While slow cooking is great sometimes, other times I don't plan ahead enough to get it done. So I cook the chicken on my stove top until no longer pink, along with the butter and seasoning packet. I substitute fat free cream of chicken soup and splash in a bit of cooking sherry with the cream cheese. And I have used powdered ranch dressing if I'm out of the other. I serve on rice from my rice cooker, and my family thinks I'm a magician!! Very tasty, simple and when done on top of the stove, fast.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm learning that everything tastes better with cream cheese, and this recipe is no exception!  The only mistake I made was using a whole chicken.  Apparently I'm the only one who didn't know that bones don't do so well in a slow cooker....Still delicious enough to deserve 5 stars!                          ***Update*** Made this again with boneless skinless breasts and omitted. Also, both times I've made this I add all ingredients at the very beginning rather than cooking several hours and adding cream cheese at the end. Once it was completely cooked it seemed a bit runny, so I shredded the breasts and put the meat back in. This made the sauce seem a little thicker, and more flavorful. Served over rice. Only complaint - needs more salt.

None
text:
As is the recipes didn't work for me. Maybe its my slow cooker, but the lowest setting seems to be too high a temp for most recipes. When I got home 6 hours later the butter had burned to the bottom of the pot and the cubed chicken pieces were burnt and most of the smaller pieces were tough and over cooked. Next, when I added the cream cheese and soup, the mixture was incredibly thick and I could tell right away that I was going to have to thin it out in order to use it as a sauce. So I added white wine and water because I didn't have milk on hand. Alterations will rescue this recipe and make it usable but As-Is, this recipe fails and serves only as a base for creative cooks to make better. I am not one so I will have to search through reviews for tips. It was very tasty though once I was done with it.

I use 8oz. Italian salad dressing in place of the dry mix and butter/margarine. Cook on low for 4 hours. I mix the soup and cream cheese right in the crock pot with my hand mixer.  I cook 8 oz of egg noodles and add those in too.  This is an ABSOLUTE favorite at our house! I have also subbed sour cream for the cream of chicken soup when I found out too late I was out.  It was delicious!

text:
This was delicious and so simple to make.  I took the advise of reviewers for my recipe - I mixed soup mix, cream soup and 1/3 cup of wine together,  Poured that mixture over chicken breasts cut into scallops.  For the last 10 minutes, I mixed in frozen peas and 1/2 block of low fat cream cheese, along with salt to taste.  My kids asked for seconds!  I served it over brown rice.  YUM!  My husband added a little hot sauce to his and raved about it.

text:
I have made this twice now. It’s great if you follow the recipe but even better with these changes:

I doubled the recipe but used the 26 oz of cream of chicken soup.
1/4 cup of white cooking wine.
1 cup of sour cream
Milk to thin to desired consistency.
Salt & Pepper to taste.
Served over Egg Noodles.

It was perfect! It’s one of our family favorites.

796003
Display Name:
Vicky Melvin Cassidy

7

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2723668.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I set out to follow this recipe exactly but ending up modifying a little as I went along.  First, I left my chicken breasts whole.  I thought they would be more tender that way.  I used reduced fat cream cheese and 98% fat free cream of chicken soup in order to make this healthier.  I placed all ingredients in slow cooker and set on low for 5 hours.  The slow cooker then went to "warm" setting until I got home 2 hours afterwards.  I decided that I would cut up the chicken before adding the cheese and soup.  The chicken was so tender that it just fell apart.  VERY yummy!  Yes, I had to taste a pinch before adding other stuff. :-)  I added soup and cream cheese and cooked on high for about 20 minutes until it was heated through and mixed smoothly.  I used NO yolks noodles and just mixed them into the pot of chicken when they were done cooking and had been drained well.  We tasted it and decided that adding some peas would give some vegetable and natural sweetness.  It reminded me of a tuna noodle casserole when it was completed.  Anyway, it turned out delicious!  We will definitely be adding this to our meal rotation!

text:
OK, I didn't have chicken; so I used some boneless pork chops. And I didn't have Italian dressing mix, so I used Lipton's beefy onion soup mix. I tossed the cubed meat in a ziploc with the soup mix, and put it in the crockpot with a few pats of butter, and went to Walmart. When I got home, the house smelled fantastic, and I used half of the called for cream cheese and about half a cup of sour cream, while that was warming I made a tossed salad; cooked noodles, and browned a loaf of French bread. Both myself and my husband loved this recipe--I will most certainly be making this again! It was a simple tasty meal that was perfect for todays cold New Years Day weather.

text:
This was yummy!  I put whole chicken breasts in the crockpot frozen (just defrosted a few minutes in microwave, but they were still hard), sprinkled them with the italian dressing and put a few pats of soft margarine in with them.  Once they were cooked (probably about 5 to 6 hours), I shredded them with a fork and knife.  Then added the cream cheese and soup (I used Cream of Chicken with Herbs).  I had to add some paprika, pepper and some italian herbs (was a little bland to me).  I also added about a 1/2 a can of milk to make it more like a gravy.  I served it over noodles and everybody loved it!  I will definitely make this again.

Display Name:
PANDORAH

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
YUM! This is so close to the Angel Chicken recipe, which I have been avoiding, asI do NOT like cream cheese. But I made it for a potluck at work, as I figured if I didn't like it - no harm no foul ;) and um, YUMMY! I got asked about the recipe by several people.  I actually just threw it all together to cook, it was super yummy and totally fine this way. I cooked it on high for 3.5 hours. My variations: I used Campbells cream of chicken with herb soup - as that is my favorite - I find it more flavorful than regular cream of mushroom or chicken. And I added 1 small red onion, diced (for a double batch). Otherwise the ingredients were left as is (well, doubled them). I did add about 1/2 a can of milk to it (1/2 soup can) when I started it. I also peppered the chicken. I used Angel hair pasta and mixed it in with the sauce.  It was a huge hit at the potluck, and I will DEFINITELY be making this at home again and again! YUM! And so easy! Next time I think I will add mushrooms and garlic..  I used 6 chicken breasts, cubed, for a double batch. I think you could get away with 3-4 for a double batch, too.  I have 7 children, so we look for ways to be frugal.  ***** Oh and to the people who think it is too rich, it IS rich, and also very creamy - I would equate it to a dish made with heavy cream, but I like that sort of thing - so if you don't like that, this is not your recipe. But it is YUM if you do like rich creamy foods.

text:
Ok, I was skeptical about this one....but my goodness what a pleasant surprise!  I literally threw 4 frozen chicken breasts (whole not cubed), the butter and dressing mix in the crock pot and left the house.  When I came home, the place smelled amazing!   I used the "healthy request" soup and low fat cream cheese and it still turned out creamy and decadent!  And the chicken was so tender!!  This recipe is now on constant rotation in the house...and pleases everyone from my husband to my teenage son, to my 16-month old daughter.  If only every recipe was this easy!!!

text:
I used 3 frozen chicken breasts, Beefy Onion soup mix, and cream of chicken & mushroom soup. I also added a can of drained corn, chives, onion, and garlic. I cooked it all on low for 5 hours. I then shredded the chicken and then I added the fat free cream cheese and let it get hot for 30 minutes. I served it over whole wheat egg noodles.

text:
I just made this today.  I couldn't find "dry" salad dressing mix.  So I bought Kraft fat free Italian dressing.  I used probably about 1/8-1/4cup of this dressing plus liberal amounts of fresh cracked pepper.  I also added some other spices (oregano, thyme...).  I cooked it on low for 5 hours and then added the soup, low fat cream cheese and about 1.5 cups of egg noodles.  It turned out very good!  I will do this again.  I think once I re-heat it tomorrow, the flavours will have permeated throughout the chicken a bit better.

region:

country:
None
text:
I have no idea how people are getting this to turn out bland and too thick. I served it over egg noodles and it was absolutely DELICIOUS, with just the right texture for the sauce!  I had an extra tablespoon of butter in there at the beginning because I had 2 partial bars sitting around and I wanted to use it up.    I added some onions about 2 hours in, and about 1/3 of a small sour cream container at the end with the cream cheese and soup. They were leftover from taco night.  After I added the last ingredients I let it cook for an hour instead of 30 minutes, so maybe that's why the flavor from the Italian dressing mix was able to blend into the sauce better. It was FAR from bland!

text:
WOW. I was a bit skeptical of how this recipe would turn out, partially due to how few ingredients it had (silly me!), but I decided to try it based on the reviews.  I am SO glad I did. The italian dressing mix gives the chicken SUCH great flavor.  The only thing I did differently than the recipe states was to put the chicken breasts in the crockpot whole, then shred them before adding the cream cheese and soup. I had a hard time not eating all of the chicken while I was shredding it; it had SUCH great flavor!

text:
My crockpot is large and oval shaped. The chicken, margarine and dressing mix had started to burn after 5 hours on low. It's probably best made in a regular sized crockpot. I also used Zesty Italian dressing mix - the flavor was slightly over powering. I did add about a half a soup can of water. The sauce seemed a little too thick, after adding the cream cheese and condensed soup. Overall, it was ok. If I try this again, I may double the recipe to fit my large slow cooker. I'll also stick with the regular italian dressing mix or maybe use the ranch flavor.

text:
This was a quick recipe to pull together right from my cupboard and fridge. I made the following changes: I used about 1 lb. of boneless pork loin chops, ranch dressing mix (didn't have Italian today), 3/4 of a soup can of fat free half and half and 4 oz. of low fat cream cheese. I pulled the cooked meat into small pieces after 5 hours. Served over small pasta, this was terrific. I left the salt out of the pasta cooking water since the sauce tasted salty. Next time I will use canola oil instead of margarine, and garnish with a little parsley for color and a couple of twists of the pepper grinder. I will try it again with the chicken and Italian salad dressing mix. Thank you for a versatile recipe!

text:
This was really good!  It was so easy to make.  As for the reviewers who said their chicken was dry and burnt, it was probably  your slow cooker.  I have the Hamilton Beach slow cooker with the sealed top and not one ounce of the margerine (I used Smart Balance) evaporated.  Also, the sauce was not too thick.  It was thicker, but not as thick as others suggested (again maybe their slow cooker).  It tasted salty, but when it was served over pasta it tasted just right, not too salty.  I shredded my chicken when I added the cream cheese and let the cream cheese sit for 15 minutes before stirring it in.  I followed recipe exactly and I was very pleased.  My husband, mother, and two toddler daughters liked it.  My father loved it.  I kept dipping in for more.  Very easy recipe.

Thankfully, this recipe is very forgiving because I completely jacked it up. For starters, I forgot to add the Italian dressing mix in the beginning, so when I walked in from work and saw it sitting on the counter, I thought, I'll just put it in now. Then added the rest of the ingredients and some sour cream (suggestion from another reviewer). As soon as I did it, I was sorry because it smelled like Sour Cream and Onion potato chips. Still having the slightest bit of home, I let it cook for another 1/12 hour while attending a school function. When we came home, my husband and daughter said they liked it, but I just couldn't get past the smell, even though it was gone. I served it to them over whole wheat noodles, they really liked it. My daughter ate three bowls! I finally tried it and it was good, however, the smell was haunting me. Husband wants me to cook it again and add mushrooms and peas.

text:
I thought this had a really good flavor and nice texture.  I only used two large chicken breasts and had plenty of sauce.  I followed another reviewer's advice and did simmer the cubed chicken with just the butter and seasoning packet, and it got nice and brown like she said.  I then added a package of fresh sliced mushrooms and let that simmer for about 30 minutes before adding the soup and cheese.  I'm only giving this 4 stars because I thought it was a bit too salty.  Maybe next time I'll try half the italian dressing packet like others did.

This was really easy and really tasty...an excellent combination! :) I put the breasts in frozen, with the butter and italian dressing packet. Later added the healthy version of the soup and the cream cheese. The 'gravy' seemed to dry out/thicken up pretty quickly, so I added some chicken broth, but that made it pretty salty. Perhaps next time I'll add an extra can of the soup, or do as others suggested and add some wine as there was barely enough sauce...and lots of gravy is always good! :)  I served it over egg noodles. It was a big hit! :)

text:
My husband LOVES this dish. I'm just not a fan of the consistency, which is a tad on the mushy side. The first time I made it, I didn't chunk the chicken, just put it in whole and then shredded before adding the cream cheese. This made the dish a bit too thick. Recommend keeping the chicken in chunks as much as possible. Also recommend throwing in some peas for color. Otherwise, it's a pretty bland-looking meal, especially over egg noodles, which is how I usually serve it.

Excellent!  My family loved this recipe and my kids are picky, picky at times.  I did add 1/8 c water and a bit more butter. I also choose the 1/3 fat cream cheese and it was quite good. I happened to be home so I flipped the chicken half way through the 6 hr cook time.  It's more of 'roasted chicken' after cooking, which is why some folks said it was dry.  However, after adding the soup, etc. I found the chicken quite tasty and not dry at all.  Served it over egg noodles with a large green salad.  Will definitely make again!

text:
Delicious! I changed a few things to suit my tastes, as everyone does. I did cook the chicken on low for a few hours with just the butter and half the package of seasoning. Then added a can of chicken soup and mushroom soup and half a cup of beef broth. Then I let it cook on high for an hour or so. I sauteed some onions and mushrooms and added those a little while before the cream cheese. I put in only 4oz of the cream cheese and 1/3 cup of sour cream and let it heat through. I was surprised at how good it was! We had no leftovers, and I will definetly make it again soon.

text:
I didn't have 5-6 hours, so I sauteed the chicken until nearly cooked, threw in the butter and Italian dressing packet, and simmered for about 20 minutes. Then I added the rest of the ingredients and simmered for another 30 minutes. The cream cheese made it seriously decadent and on the heavy side. But the result was really good stroganoff!

text:
I'm giving this a four, because I thought it was a three, but my husband, grandma and kids gave it a 5!  It's super simple tasting, but filling and hearty.  I doubled the recipe (to have ample leftovers to freeze) and used 1.5 blocks of cream cheese, one cream of chicken and one cream of celery soups.  Threw in fresh sliced mushrooms once the soups and cream cheese were all blended.  Served with some green beans and french bread and it was a huge hit (I just didn't personally think it was outstanding).

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I doubled the recipe, adding 1/2 cup of cooking sherry with the butter, dressing mix (two packages) and cubed, thawed chicken.  The consistency of the sauce was absolutely perfect and not at all salty!  I used Healthy Request soup, 1/3 reduced fat free cream cheese and added 1/2 pint of sour cream and sliced mushrooms.  Next time I will try fat free cream cheese, as reviews indicate that flavor is not compromised.  My parents and father-in-law came for dinner and went on and on about the meal.  I served with whole wheat egg noodles, fresh bread and a salad. So simple to throw together and delicious too!  This recipe will become a regular in our home.

I only used half the recommended cream cheese and than 4 0z of sour cream at the end.  (Sorry!  I hate it when people change the recipe).  I also used reduced fat cream cheese and sour cream. I had it on low for only a couple of hours and it was almost done, so I turned it to warm for another two hours.  Easy recipe with easy ingredients.

userID:
2289671
Display Name:
HappyMommy2
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
77
favoritesCount:
50
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674134.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I had 3/4 can of evaporated milk left over from making carmel nut brownies.  This recipe looked good.  I made it with a few changes due to what I had on hand.  I used french onion dip packet with about 8 chicken breasts.  I used 2 tbps butter and the evaporated milk with the low fat cream cheese and chicken flavored soup and added sliced fresh mushrooms.  It was super!  The grown ups in our house loved it.  The kids ate the chicken and that was all.  I usually make the Easy Chicken from this site, but I think we like this one better.  The chicken was able to be cut up in bites not shreaded since it was not soaking in liquid while cooking.  That seems to work better for the kids.
Review:
Rating:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
DELICIOUS!  I didn't have a package of dry Italian-style salad dressing mix so I found a recipe for "Italian Herb Salad Dressing mix Clone" at www.recipezaar.com  Slightly modifying (decreasing) that recipe, I used 1 tsp. oregano, basil, paprika and freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 tsp. onion powder, 1 TBS garlic powder, and two packets of granulated sugar and added that to the chicken in this recipe in lieu of the Italian dressing mix.  The recipe was not salty and didn't need anymore garlic as others noted.  I used Campbell's 98% fat free cream of chicken soup and I only had a 1/2 brick of cream cheese (again, that's what I had on hand) but it worked great.  I first kept the chicken cubed but shredded it later; I definitely recommend shredding the chicken.  Since I used only 1/2 brick of cream cheese, you should probably add milk or sour cream to thin it out but it still tastes GREAT as is...this is a definite keeper!

A super comfort dish for a frigid day! I started with boneless chicken thighs, the seasoning and only 1 tablespoon of butter, along with a couple of glugs of white wine. Hmmm... Mine shredded into a very odd chicken-paste.  I gave it 4 stars because the TASTE is very good, and the recipe is so fast/easy.  I would like to give this one another chance -- maybe try cooking on high for a shorter period of time so the chicken won't shred as much (???) text:
I thought this was pretty good...not as good as I may have hoped, though.  I started with frozen chicken breasts, and they easily shredded after 6 hours on low.  I did slice up a yellow onion and put that in the Crock Pot with the chicken in the beginning, but it was barely noticible in the final dish.  I know some reviewers had complained that the sauce was too rich and thick...before adding the soup, I drained off the liquid in the pot, and then thinned the sauce with chicken stock...that seemed to work.  I guess I was mainly disappointed by the lack of texture in this dish...the shredded chicken, sauce and noodles all seemed to meld into one.  I did add some peas, but next time I'm definately going to add more veggies to the sauce to mix things up a bit.

userID:
1489968
Display Name:
Amber
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/80275.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was very tasty and filling. Of course, I can never make a recipe as is, so I did tweak it a little, partially to due to necessity, and part due to personal preferences.

I made this using a pack of chicken drumsticks since its what I had on hand. I doubled the soup and used the whole packet of the Italian seasoning (other reviewers suggest using only half for the normal portioned recipe) since I had a little more chicken than what the breasts would have provided. I kept the butter and cream cheese the same though.

 I let the margarine melt in the crock on high, and added I some leftover chopped onion, a clove of chopped garlic and a pack of sliced mushrooms (whats a stroganoff without some FRESH mushrooms!) and let them get a little softened, then added the chicken. 

Since I wasn't sure it if would work the same for drumsticks as chicken breast, I added the soup in with the drumsticks and added a little bit of milk and white wine. Cooked it on low until the chicken could be shredded off the drumsticks, removed the leftover bones, and cooked a little longer.  Then I added the cream cheese and about a quarter cup of sour cream.  

I also mixed in a few dashes of worcestershire, since my favorite beef stroganoff recipes uses for it, and I love the tangy flavor. 

There were minimal complaints on it from my picky eater kids; my 5 year old just wasn't fond of the mushrooms I added. 

I served it over bow-tie pasta.  It was very delish.  Only complaint is that my cream chees
Review:
Rating:
3
dateLastModified:
2009-01-04T04:24:50.547

I thought this was really good. I did mess up and accidentally used a creamy Ranch dressing packet instead of the onein the recipe but I think it still turned out really tasty. It reminded me a bit of the tetrazini (sp) the cooks used to make from scratch at the country elementary school I went to as a kid back in the stone age. I added cooked noodles to this, about a pound of spaghetti, and hubby yummed it up. Thanks for sharing! My picky children wouldn't eat it, but my 9 year old did eat the chicken chunks and said they were delicious! High praise.

text:
The way I made this way way too thick( even though I love the thickness of Alfredo, after refrigeration it was almost solid) and bland. My husband who always loves and brags about my cooking hated it. If I try again, I would sub half the cream cheese with sour cream. Also I put 3/4 of my zesty Italian mix, because a lot of the other reviews said that it was too salty and strong. That was a bad idea because it ended up tasting like only a bowl of cream cheese. The chicken came out really soft though. Other than omitting a little of the Italian, I think it would still be pretty tasteless with all of it. Something else would need to be added. Pretty bad recipe, threw it away - what a waste of time and ingredients.

text:
I made this today as we had a new pastor installation ceremony to go to at church this afternoon and I wanted something I knew would be ready when we got home. I served it with  instant mashed potatoes because we were really late and didn't have time to make noodles. It was fantastic. Next time I'll go with the low-fat version of the soup and cream cheese because it is very high in fat content, but this time I just used what I already had on hand and that was the full fat stuff. Thanks for a great recipe. It was super easy and we'll definitely be having this again. 
UP-DATE:
It's been nearly three years since the first time I made this the first time and to tell the truth I simply forgot about it until a friend suggested a sismilar recipe. So, I'm making it agian only this time I added a can of low fat cream of celery and about 1/3 cup of  bottled Italian dressing since I'm out of the dry mix. I also added about 2 & 1/2 cups of frozen mixed vegetables to the crock-pot, skipped the butter and added the cream of chicken soup. Just before I serve it I'll add in the cream cheese and serve with noodles or maybe over biscuits. I'll up-date with the results.

text:
I changed the recipe a bit. I used one can cream of chicken, one can cream of mushroom (both 98% fat free), thinned it with 3/4 cup College Inn Culinary Broth (white wine & herb) and added the dressing packet.  Put it all in the crock pot with 6 whole chicken breasts.  Let is slow cook on low for 4 hours, shredded the chicken, added 1 1/2 cups frozen sweet peas, cream cheese and slow cooked another hour, finished it off with two big dollops of sour cream.  Served over noodles...what a hit, family loved it!!

text:
I made this the other night, so when it showed up as "Recipe of the Day" I had to chime in.

Liked it, didn't love it.  Surprised that the white meat chicken wasn't overly dry in the end product, like slow-cooker white meat often is.  But, in the end, it tasted like a glorified chicken version of tuna casserole (served it over noodles).  Good starter recipe, but I'd definitely play with it to go beyond the 1950s feel.  My kids liked it, but in the end the adult rating was:  it was decent, but worth the calories...???

(As always, used lower fat versions of cream cheese, etc.  I have yet to see where that made a huge difference, unless using no fat in baking...)

This was pretty good.  I did make a couple changes because of what I had on hand.  I used butter instead of margarine, and cream of celery soup because I didn't have cream of chicken. I tried to thin it out with some milk.  It wasn't bad, and I will try this one again.

text:
This recipe is a new family favorite.  My husband and two kids (3 & 5 y.o.) ate this up.  I made the recipe with the exact ingredients called for.  The only change I made, to ease the initial preparation, was to put the chicken breasts in whole and let them cook 6 hours.  Then, when I add the cream cheese and soup I shred the chicken inside the crockpot with two forks.  This dish was definitely not spicy-- my kids loved it.  I will be making this again soon.  Thanks for the great recipe!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
As written, I gave the recipe 4 stars because I found it to be salty with all that Italian dressing mix.  If I like a recipe, I'll try it at least twice so I braised the chicken in olive oil first, and then put them in the slower cooker with 2 tbsps homemade Italian Dressing Mix (recipe available on allrecipes.com.) When it came time to add the cream of chicken soup and the cream cheese I, also, added some sliced onions and canned mushrooms.  This is wonderful over rice or noodles.  I did fix this a 3rd time and, after removing the tender chicken, I added bow tie pasta to the cream of chicken mixture and cooked an addition 30-45 mins. After the pasta cooked, I shredded the cooked chicken and mixed it all together.  I'm thinking 1 cup of peas would be good in this, too.  All in all, a good recipe. Thanks!!

text:
After reading the reviews, I placed the frozen boneless chicken breasts fillets(which were less then 3/4 inches thick) in the crockpot and then flaked them apart after cooking for 8 hours. Then added the cream cheese and cream of chicken soup and cooked for 30 minutes. It not only saved time but the Chicken Stoganoff turned out great!! This is an excellent base recipe where one can adjust/add to the recipe to suit one's own taste!!! Thanks for a GREAT recipe!!

This was very good, the whole family loved it. I thought the sauce was a bit rich, but of course I still ate way more than I should have! The only changes I made were to add about 3/4 cup of sour cream (I didn't measure, just used what was left in the container) and I ended up making it in the oven because it was a last minute dinner choice. I just mixed it all up and baked for 35 minutes at 375. Served over egg noodles. Next time, I think I'll use all low fat ingredients and whole grain noodles to make it healthier.

A savory and creamy wonderland that dances in your mouth. This dish was very easy to make. With only 5 ingredients, it is simple to make for even the extreme novice. In the end, the sauce is creamy smooth, the chicken is flavoured through and through, and is very moist. This stroganoff compliments an array of things such as pastas, rice, or even try it topped on a buttery piece of toasted baguette. Add fresh basil for a touch of sweetness. Simple and fantastic.

text:
I really wanted to love this recipe, but I have to say that it was surprisingly bland...  Made it yesterday for myself and boyfriend and while it wasn't bad enough to toss - neither of us went back for seconds.  The Italian Dressing Seasoning didn't leave the zip I had expected, and even combined with the salty condensed soup - it really wasn't enough to balance out the mild cream cheese.  As for the Chicken, in the end it could have easily been mistaken for chunked canned Tuna (not necessarily a bad thing I suppose).  Personally, I won't be making this one again.

country:
None
text:
I do not slow cook. So I used chicken tenders cut into bite size pieces, sauted the chicken with some diced onion and garlic. When the chicken was done I added the seasoning and soup (I used a can of Cream of Mushroom and Cream of Celery) and some mushrooms (just cause I love mushrooms) let it cook for about 40 minutes then added the cream cheese. I added sour cream right before serving. The seasoning was not enough for me, so I sprinkled a little creole seasoning on mine.  I used the Healthy Recipe soups, together with low fat cream cheese and low fat sour cream, really, really good!!

userID:
1241884
Display Name:
Duckball
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/678436.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was AWESOME! I used two gigantic chicken breast halves (almost 1½ pounds total) cut into small bite-sized pieces. I also used the Italian Dressing Mix recipe from this site (scaled down to 2 servings) and 1 TBS margarine. I let it cook, stirring the chicken pieces two or three times, for about 8 hours on low. I then added the cream cheese and a can of cream of celery soup (I have found cream of chicken soup to be a little too sweet for our tastes). I let it cook on high for an hour or so, stirred it, and served over egg noodles. Very tasty and made great leftovers! Thanks for sharing, Judi!

text:
I've been meaning to rate this recipe for a while. I actually made this one night for company, doubling the recipe and was so glad that I did. It was amazing. I did add some fresh mushrooms to it as well. Last night, I had some left over marinated garlic and herb chicken breasts that had been done on the grill. I just shredded them up, threw everything in the crockpot on low until it heated thru and my goodness, it was yummy. Thanks for a winner!! UPDATE!! I have since made this recipe substituting boneless pork. Just as amazing if not better. I always use the cream cheese but also stir in some sour cream at the end because we like things a little on the saucier side. This is always at least a once a month recipe.

Very easy!  I added 1/4 c. water (an idea I got from a similar recipe on another site), used Zesty Italian mix, cooked in the soup, put the chicken breasts in frozen, then shredded them at the time I added the cream cheese.  Everyone liked them.  It didn't make all that much.  I'd probably double it if we had anyone else over.  (Our family at nearly the whole recipe:  mom, dad, kids ages 8, 5, and 1).  This will be a good "soccer practice" day meal!
